page.title: 17Education in Jedburgh
page.content: There are two primary schools.The catchment area for Parkside School lies North of Oxnam Rd. and that of Howdenburn to the South.Both schools take pupils for the first 7 years of education.Parkside has a nursery class taking pupils from all parts of the town.Each school has approx.200 pupils 8 class teachers,a remedial teacher and a headmaster.These schools are feeder schools for Jedburgh Grammar School which is a six year comprehensive.It also takes pupils who travel by bus from the surrounding area.It has 436 pupils and 28 teaching staff and 3 rectorial staff.For further education,students must travel outwith the area.Learning exchange groups,in various subjects,have been set up by the Community Council to take the place of Evening classes.
